column15: Ruby infuses the formal with the abject
column16: allowing materials to melt and overlap in biomorphic and geomorphic aggregations. Rubyâ€™s current exhibition features the largest basins that he has produced to date in the Basin Theology series
column17: as well as figurative and totemic ceramics that recall common artifacts. Ceramic cradles bear an eerie resemblance to graves
column18: evoking the cyclical nature of human life
column19: and otherwise abstract totems stand upright
column20: like soldiers in formation. These deep
column21: textured vessels contain studio remnants and discarded fragments set beneath viscous glazes. Their variegated surfaces feature coloristic effects resulting from different stages of kiln-firing. In the layered glazes that engulf shards of ceramic debris
